fields.name: ZEN_SERVER
fields.label: Zen Server
fields.description: Hostname or IP Address of the database server

paramGroups.name: default
paramGroups.label: Microsoft Azure Connection
paramGroups.description: This information is required as the template temporarily stages data on Azure Blob Storage for faster data loading using COPY VWLOAD functionality of Avalanche.

fields.name: AZURE_CLIENT_ID
fields.label: Azure Client ID
fields.description: Avalanche authenticates through Azure Active Directory to read and ingest data from an Azure Blob storage account. You need to create a service principal and provide its credentials to allow Avalanche access to the data.

fields.name: AZURE_CONTAINER_NAME
fields.label: Azure Container Name
fields.description: Name of the container in the Azure storage account which contains the data files.

fields.name: AVALANCHE_CONNECT_STRING
fields.label: Select Avalanche Warehouse
fields.description: List of warehouses which exist in [AWS|Microsoft Azure].

fields.name: AVALANCHE_USERNAME
fields.label: Username
fields.description: Avalanche database username used to connect to the database. The default user is dbuser.

fields.name: AVALANCHE_PASSWORD
fields.label: Password
fields.description: Connection database password used to connect to the database.

fields.name: AVALANCHE_TABLE
fields.label: Table
fields.description: Avalanche table name where data will be written to.

fields.name: OUTPUT_MODE
fields.label: Output Mode
fields.description: Append: Inserts the records. If the table doesn't exist, it will be created. Truncate & Append: Truncates the table before inserting. Replace: Drops & Creates the table

fields.name: AVALANCHE_DBADMIN_GROUP_ACCESS
fields.label: Provide table access in Avalanche Query Editor
fields.description: This option grants new table access to the 'dbadmingrp' group.

fields.name: create_table_query_checkbox
fields.label: Specify optional table creation query file
fields.description: The template will automatically create the table. If you would like to use a custom create query statement, provide a file containing the create table query. The partitioning must be specified. The table name in the statement must match the table name above.

fields.name: AVALANCHE_CREATE_TABLE_QUERY
fields.label: Create Table Query
fields.description: Specify a create table statement to use for creating the table. Make sure partitioning is specified. Table name in the statement should match the table name above.

advanceMacros.name: ZEN_QUERY
advanceMacros.description: SQL query for fetching data. Value can be query statement itself or a path to the query file. In case of path, prefix the value with "file:///".

advanceMacros.name: ZEN_TRNS_ISOLATION
advanceMacros.description: Transaction Isolation setting for the ODBC Connection. Allowed values are 'serializable', 'repeatable read', 'read committed', 'read uncommitted'

advanceMacros.name: ZEN_WHERE_STMT
advanceMacros.description: Where statement to filter source records. Statement should exclude 'WHERE' keyword and be syntactically correct as per Zen's SQL grammer. Not applicable if query statement is used instead of table.

advanceMacros.name: ZEN_JDBC_DRIVER_JAR_LOCATION
advanceMacros.description: If you want to use JDBC instead of ODBC for connecting to Zen, then you can specify zen jdbc driver jar location using this macro. Value can be a path to the directory containing jar files or the jar file itself.

advanceMacros.name: ZEN_CONNECTION_TYPE
advanceMacros.description: Specify the connector to use for connecting to zen. Allowed values are jdbc/odbc.

advanceMacros.name: AVALANCHE_CREATE_TABLE_QUERY
advanceMacros.description: Create table statement to use for creating the table. Make sure partitioning is specified. Table name in the query should match the value of AVALANCHE_TABLE macro.

advanceMacros.name: AVALANCHE_CREATE_TABLE_OPTIONS
advanceMacros.description: Use this option when you don't want to build the whole query but just want to specify options to pass in the "with" clause of create table query. This macro is ignored if AVALANCHE_CREATE_TABLE_QUERY macro is defined. Make sure partitioning is specified.

advanceMacros.name: OUTPUT_MODE
advanceMacros.description: What table operations need to be performed before inserting data. Following options are available. "replace": Drops/Creates table, "delete_append": Truncates table before inserting. "append": Creates table only if doesn't exist and inserts records. Default is "append".

advanceMacros.name: DEFAULT_TEXT_COL_SIZE
advanceMacros.description: Set the default size of the text columns in the table. Set it to a reasonable value based on your data to avoid truncation.

advanceMacros.name: UNICODE_CHARS
advanceMacros.description: Tells whether the data contains unicode characters. Value can be True or False. If True, nvarchar data type is used for text columns.

advanceMacros.name: BATCH_SIZE
advanceMacros.description: Specifies the size of the chunk (in terms of number of records), the source is split into. Default is 50000.

advanceMacros.name: COPYVW_PARALLEL_LOAD_SIZE
advanceMacros.description: Number of chunks to load parallely using COPY VWLOAD. Default is 20.

advanceMacros.name: AVALANCHE_DBADMIN_GROUP_ACCESS
advanceMacros.description: Grant table access to "dbadmingrp" group. Only applicable when new table is created. Default is True.

advanceMacros.name: TRUNCATION_HANDLING
advanceMacros.description: Specifies truncation handling for text data. Following values are supported. "ignore" - Ignores the truncation and continues the execution. "warn" - Logs a warning about truncation and continues the execution. "error" - Logs an error message and aborts the execution. Default is "error".

name: Zen to Avalanche Azure
description: This template is used to load data from Actian Zen Database tables into Avalanche warehouse.
